Package com.github.actionfx.core.annotation

Annotation Type AFXFromTextInputDialog

  • @Documented
@Retention(RUNTIME)
@Target(PARAMETER)
public @interface AFXFromTextInputDialog
    Method argument annotation for requesting a text input of type String from a "text input" dialog.

    The layout of the dialog is as follows: 

     ------------------------------------------------------
 | Title                                              |
 |----------------------------------------------------|
 |                                                    |
 | Header Text                                        |
 |                                                                                                  |
 |----------------------------------------------------|
 | Content Text   [Default Value                   ]  |
 |                                                    |
 |               [OK]     [Cancel]                    |
 ------------------------------------------------------
    Author:
    koster

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      java.lang.String content
      A content text to be displayed in the text input dialog.
      java.lang.String contentKey
      A resource bundle property key for the content text to be displayed in the text input dialog.
      boolean continueOnCancel
      Flag that determines what shall happen, in case the user cancels the "text input" dialog.
      java.lang.String defaultValue
      A default value to be set into the text field of the "text input" dialog.
      java.lang.String header
      A header text to be displayed in the text input dialog.
      java.lang.String headerKey
      A resource bundle property key for the header text to be displayed in the text input dialog.
      java.lang.String title
      A title text to be displayed in the text input dialog.
      java.lang.String titleKey
      A resource bundle property key for the title text to be displayed in the text input dialog.

    • Element Detail

      • title

        java.lang.String title
        A title text to be displayed in the text input dialog. In case titleKey() is set, than this value as a lower priority.
        Returns:
        the text input dialog title
        Default:
        "Text Input"

      • header

        java.lang.String header
        A header text to be displayed in the text input dialog. In case headerKey() is set, than this value as a lower priority.
        Returns:
        the text input dialog header text
        Default:
        ""

      • content

        java.lang.String content
        A content text to be displayed in the text input dialog. In case contentKey() is set, than this value as a lower priority.
        Returns:
        the text input dialog content text
        Default:
        ""

      • titleKey

        java.lang.String titleKey
        A resource bundle property key for the title text to be displayed in the text input dialog. A value in this attribute has a higher priority than the value specified in title().
        Returns:
        the resource bundle property key for a text input dialog title
        Default:
        ""

      • headerKey

        java.lang.String headerKey
        A resource bundle property key for the header text to be displayed in the text input dialog. A value in this attribute has a higher priority than the value specified in header().
        Returns:
        the resource bundle property key for a text input dialog header text
        Default:
        ""

      • contentKey

        java.lang.String contentKey
        A resource bundle property key for the content text to be displayed in the text input dialog. A value in this attribute has a higher priority than the value specified in content().
        Returns:
        the resource bundle property key for a text input dialog content text
        Default:
        ""

      • defaultValue

        java.lang.String defaultValue
        A default value to be set into the text field of the "text input" dialog.
        Returns:
        the default value to set in the "text input" dialog.
        Default:
        ""

      • continueOnCancel

        boolean continueOnCancel
        Flag that determines what shall happen, in case the user cancels the "text input" dialog. By default, the method invocation is also cancelled, when the "text input" dialog is cancelled. If this flag is set to true, the method is invoked even if the "text input" dialog is cancelled. In that case, the method argument will be null.
        Returns:
        true, if the method shall be invoked, even if the "text input" dialog is cancelled, false, if the method invocation shall be also cancelled. Default is false.
        Default:
        false
